summary: G. Robert Blakey was involved with the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). A letter from Blakey to Scott Breckinridge at the CIA requests assistance in arranging interviews in Mexico with several individuals for the HSCA. This indicates Blakey's role in actively pursuing leads and gathering information related to the JFK assassination investigation. The documents suggest he was a key figure in the HSCA's efforts to investigate the assassination and gather information from various sources, including the CIA.
significance: G. Robert Blakey's significance in the JFK context lies in his role within the HSCA, specifically his involvement in requesting assistance from the CIA to conduct interviews in Mexico, indicating his active participation in the investigation of the JFK assassination.
